EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.question: What is the name of your organization and core business model?
Do you develop, import, or distribute AI systems in the EU?
Do you use third-party AI systems internally or embed them in your own services?
Have you identified and classified your AI systems according to the EU AI Act categories (prohibited, high-risk, limited-risk, minimal-risk)?
Are you operating or planning to operate any high-risk AI systems?
Have you appointed a responsible compliance officer or internal function for high-risk AI systems?
Do you maintain a technical documentation file for each high-risk AI system?
Have you conducted a conformity assessment for any high-risk system?
Do you maintain a quality management system (QMS) for your AI development lifecycle?
Have you registered any high-risk systems in the EU AI Act public database?
Do you perform risk assessments for your AI systems?
Do you have documented procedures for data governance and dataset quality?
Do you conduct pre-deployment testing and post-deployment monitoring?
Do you have mechanisms to detect and manage performance drift or model degradation?
Do you track incidents or malfunctions related to AI systems?
Do your systems include transparency documentation and user instructions?
Is meaningful human oversight implemented and documented?
Do you provide documentation on system limitations and intended purpose?
Are logs or audit trails retained for traceability of system outputs?
Have you conducted a data protection impact assessment (DPIA) where applicable?
Do you have documented measures to prevent bias, discrimination, or unfair outcomes?
Do you ensure that users are informed when they interact with an AI system?
Have you adopted ethical guidelines or principles for AI development and deployment?

EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.step: Step 6: Vendor, Supply Chain, and Third-Party AI
EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.question: Do you use third-party AI systems or components (models, datasets, APIs)?

EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.step: Step 6: Vendor, Supply Chain, and Third-Party AI
EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.question: Do you vet third-party AI systems for risk classification and compliance?

EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.step: Step 6: Vendor, Supply Chain, and Third-Party AI
EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.question: Are third-party system providers contractually obligated to meet EU AI Act requirements?
Do staff involved in AI development or oversight receive regular training?
Do you maintain internal documentation on lessons learned, improvements, or incidents?
Do you conduct regular internal reviews or audits of your AI governance program?

EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.step: Step 7: Foundation Models and Advanced AI Systems
EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.question: Do you develop, import, or deploy foundation models with >10^25 FLOPs?

EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.step: Step 7: Foundation Models and Advanced AI Systems
EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.question: Do you maintain model cards and systemic risk evaluations for foundation models?

EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.step: Step 7: Foundation Models and Advanced AI Systems
EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.question: Do you implement and test cybersecurity measures for foundation models?

EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.step: Step 7: Foundation Models and Advanced AI Systems
EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.question: Do you track and report downstream use of your foundation models?

EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.step: Step 8: Market Surveillance and Incident Reporting
EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.question: Do you report serious incidents to relevant market surveillance authorities?

EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.step: Step 8: Market Surveillance and Incident Reporting
EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.question: Do you cooperate with market surveillance investigations and requests?

EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.step: Step 8: Market Surveillance and Incident Reporting
EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.question: Do you maintain post-market monitoring systems for deployed AI systems?

EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.step: Step 9: CE Marking and Conformity Assessment
EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.question: Have you engaged notified bodies for conformity assessment of high-risk systems?

EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.step: Step 9: CE Marking and Conformity Assessment
EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.question: Do you maintain technical documentation files for CE marking requirements?

EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.step: Step 9: CE Marking and Conformity Assessment
EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.question: Do you comply with relevant harmonized standards (e.g., ISO/IEC 23053, 23894)?

EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.step: Step 9: CE Marking and Conformity Assessment
EU AI ACT Onboarding Questionaire.question: Do you maintain EU authorized representative arrangements where required?
Do you assess systemic risks and societal impact of your AI systems?
Do you evaluate AI system impact on fundamental rights?
Do you implement measures to prevent misuse of dual-use AI systems?

ISO 27001 Questionaire.question: What is your company name and primary business activity?
What best describes your industry or sector?
How many employees do you have (globally)?
Which countries do you operate in or store/process data in?
Do you already hold any certifications (e.g., ISO 9001, SOC 2)?
Which teams or locations should be included in the ISMS scope?
Will the ISMS apply to your entire company or a specific subset?
Are customers' data or services managed on their behalf (e.g., SaaS)?
Who are the primary stakeholders for your ISMS (internal and external)?
What are your main reasons for implementing ISO 27001?
Do you know of any laws or contracts you must comply with?
Have there been any notable risks, audits, or incidents in the past 2 years?
Who will act as your ISMS Owner (typically a C-level role)?
Who will manage the day-to-day ISMS implementation?
Have you performed a formal risk assessment?
Do you track identified risks and assign them owners?
Do you classify risks by likelihood and impact?
Do you regularly review or update your risk register?
Have there been any security incidents or breaches?
Do you have an incident response plan or playbook?
Has it been tested or simulated?
Do you notify affected parties or regulators when required?
What infrastructure types do you use?
Is infrastructure centrally or team-managed?
Do you maintain an up-to-date asset inventory?
Is data classified by sensitivity?
Do you securely dispose of or wipe decommissioned assets?
Do you perform regular verified backups?
Do you define RTO and RPO for your critical systems?
Do you assign access based on roles or least privilege?
Do you perform periodic access reviews?
Is Multi-Factor Authentication (MFA) enforced?
Do you document onboarding and offboarding procedures?
Do you use version control (e.g., Git) for code and infra?
Are changes to production reviewed or approved?
Do you have rollback or change failure protocols?
Do you use testing or static/dynamic analysis tools?
Do you collect logs from production systems?
How long are logs retained?
Do you investigate unusual activity in logs?
Do you use automated alerting or anomaly detection?
Do you have written security policies?
Would you like to use our AI-generated templates as a starting point?
Do employees acknowledge policies formally?
Do you provide security training to employees?
Do you run campaigns (e.g., phishing simulations)?
Do you maintain a vendor list, including SaaS providers?
Do you assess vendor security or request certifications?
Do you have signed contracts or DPAs with suppliers?
Do you re-evaluate vendors periodically?
Do you conduct internal audits of your ISMS or security?
Are findings logged and followed up with actions?
Do you hold annual management reviews of the ISMS?
Do you track legal, regulatory, or customer compliance obligations?
Do you implement physical access controls for facilities housing IT assets?
Do you monitor environmental conditions (temperature, humidity, power) in critical facilities?
Are equipment and media securely disposed of or sanitized before disposal?
Do you protect against environmental threats (fire, flood, earthquake)?
Do you maintain a business continuity plan (BCP) covering IT systems and data?
Do you conduct regular business continuity tests and exercises?
Do you maintain alternative processing facilities or cloud regions for critical systems?
Are critical business processes documented with dependencies and recovery procedures?
Do you monitor system capacity and performance thresholds?
Do you implement network security controls (firewalls, IDS/IPS, network segmentation)?
Are software installations and updates controlled and authorized?
Do you conduct regular vulnerability assessments and penetration testing?
Do you assess and monitor security risks in your supply chain?
Do you require suppliers to meet specific security requirements?
Do you maintain software bills of materials (SBOMs) for critical systems?
Do you conduct security reviews of supplier services before onboarding?

ISO 42001 2023 AI Management Onboarding.question: What is your organization’s name, mission, and core business activities involving AI?
Who are your interested parties (internal/external stakeholders) in relation to AI systems?
Have you defined the scope of your AI management system?
What AI systems are in use, planned, or in development?
What are your organization’s strategic objectives for AI use?
Do you have a designated person or role responsible for the AI management system?
Have you established or published an AI Policy?
Do you have a methodology for identifying and evaluating AI-related risks and opportunities?
Do you assess risks not just to the business but also to people, society, or the environment?
Are mitigation actions tracked and assigned owners?
Are risks and controls reviewed regularly by leadership?
Have you documented the AI system lifecycle phases (from planning to retirement)?
Do you document and control data sources, preprocessing, and quality checks?
Are model development practices documented (e.g., architecture, training method, testing)?
Are deployment, versioning, and rollback procedures defined?
Are monitoring, drift detection, and error-handling documented post-deployment?
Do you implement access controls, audit trails, and security testing for AI infrastructure?
Have you adopted AI ethics principles (e.g., fairness, accountability, transparency)?
Do you evaluate your systems for bias, discrimination, or unfair outcomes?
Is meaningful human oversight defined and documented?
Do you track explainability and interpretability of models for affected users?
Do users and stakeholders receive appropriate transparency documentation or disclosures?
Do you maintain documented procedures for all AI management system activities?
Are documents and records version-controlled and reviewed periodically?
Is there a defined communication plan for AI-related responsibilities internally and externally?
Do personnel receive training on AI policies, procedures, and risk factors?
Do you define and track measurable AI performance objectives (KPIs)?
Do you conduct internal audits of the AI management system?
Do you conduct management reviews of AI risks, objectives, and outcomes?
Do you document corrective and preventive actions for nonconformities?

ISO 42001 2023 AI Management Onboarding.step: Step 8: AI Supply Chain and Third-Party Management
ISO 42001 2023 AI Management Onboarding.question: Do you assess AI governance maturity of technology suppliers and vendors?

ISO 42001 2023 AI Management Onboarding.step: Step 8: AI Supply Chain and Third-Party Management
ISO 42001 2023 AI Management Onboarding.question: Do you maintain an inventory of third-party AI components and their risks?

ISO 42001 2023 AI Management Onboarding.step: Step 8: AI Supply Chain and Third-Party Management
ISO 42001 2023 AI Management Onboarding.question: Do you require contractual AI governance commitments from suppliers?

ISO 42001 2023 AI Management Onboarding.step: Step 8: AI Supply Chain and Third-Party Management
ISO 42001 2023 AI Management Onboarding.question: Do you monitor ongoing AI governance compliance of key suppliers?
Do you measure AI system business impact and effectiveness against objectives?
Do you track AI system fairness and bias metrics across different populations?
Do you measure and report on AI system environmental impact and sustainability?
Do you engage external stakeholders in AI governance decisions and reviews?
Do you participate in industry AI governance initiatives or standard-setting bodies?
Do you publish transparency reports on AI governance and system performance?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 1: Organization & Data Processing Context
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: What is your organization’s name, legal entity, and primary activities?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you process personal data of EU residents?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Are you a data controller, processor, or both?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you maintain a record of processing activities (RoPA)?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Have you appointed a Data Protection Officer (DPO)?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you rely on subprocessors or third parties for data processing?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you request and log consent where required?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do users have the ability to withdraw or manage their consent preferences?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you process any special category or sensitive personal data?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 3: Rights of the Data Subject
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you support DSARs (access, rectification, erasure, restriction, objection, portability)?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you maintain a log of DSARs and fulfillment timelines?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you verify identity of the requester before fulfilling DSARs?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you notify third parties or subprocessors when DSARs affect shared data?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you maintain a data protection policy and privacy notice?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 4: Privacy Governance & Documentation
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you have a privacy-by-design and default checklist for new systems?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 4: Privacy Governance & Documentation
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Have you conducted a DPIA (Data Protection Impact Assessment)?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 4: Privacy Governance & Documentation
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you conduct regular reviews of your data protection policies and risk posture?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 4: Privacy Governance & Documentation
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you train employees on data protection principles and GDPR obligations?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 4: Privacy Governance & Documentation
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you have a defined breach notification and escalation procedure?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 4: Privacy Governance & Documentation
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you use cookies or tracking technologies on your website or app?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 4: Privacy Governance & Documentation
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you maintain a privacy notice that addresses all required GDPR disclosures (Articles 13–14)?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 5: Advanced International Transfers
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you conduct Transfer Impact Assessments (TIAs) for international data flows to high-risk jurisdictions?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 5: Advanced International Transfers
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you implement supplementary measures beyond Standard Contractual Clauses (SCCs)?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 5: Advanced International Transfers
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you monitor changes in adequacy decisions and adjust transfer mechanisms accordingly?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you have joint controller agreements where you share processing decisions with other organizations?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you manage complex processing chains involving multiple controllers and processors?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you coordinate GDPR obligations (DSARs, breaches) across joint processing arrangements?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you provide meaningful information about the logic, significance, and consequences of automated processing?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you implement safeguards for automated decision-making (human review, appeal mechanisms)?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you implement privacy-enhancing technologies (PETs) such as homomorphic encryption or secure multiparty computation?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you conduct regular data protection audits and compliance assessments?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you maintain data breach detection and notification systems?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you use or provide any systems that include artificial intelligence, machine learning, or automated decision-making?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Have you classified your AI systems by risk level (e.g., minimal, limited, high-risk)?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do any AI systems affect employment, education, credit, healthcare, legal outcomes, or other sensitive domains?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you document the development lifecycle of your AI systems (design, data, testing, deployment, monitoring)?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Are all data sources and data processing steps used for AI model training documented and governed?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you track and maintain records of all training and testing datasets?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you version-control models, pipelines, and outputs?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you assess potential harm, bias, or discriminatory impact of AI systems?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you provide meaningful human oversight (e.g., approval, override, accountability)?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Is there a fallback or appeal mechanism when users are impacted by automated decisions?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Have your AI systems been tested for performance across different population segments?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you generate or publish documentation that explains how AI decisions are made?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you inform users when they are interacting with an AI system?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Are AI outputs logged with sufficient metadata for traceability?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do logs include version IDs, inputs, key processing steps, and outcomes?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do developers and testers receive regular training on responsible AI practices and ethical AI development?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you conduct post-deployment monitoring of AI model performance and behavioral drift?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you track and investigate incidents, anomalies, or failures involving AI systems?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you document lessons learned and update processes based on incidents or user feedback?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you participate in responsible AI disclosure programs or publish responsible use commitments?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you assess and document third-party AI components, models, and APIs for security and governance risks?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you maintain contracts with AI vendors that include governance, security, and compliance requirements?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you monitor ongoing compliance and performance of third-party AI services?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you test AI systems against adversarial attacks, prompt injection, and security vulnerabilities?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you implement input validation and output filtering for AI systems?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you maintain incident response procedures specific to AI security breaches?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you provide meaningful information about AI decision logic to affected individuals?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you implement right to explanation and automated decision appeal mechanisms?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you maintain audit trails for AI decisions that affect individual rights or significant outcomes?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: How do you coordinate AI governance with other compliance requirements (GDPR, ISO 27001, etc.)?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you maintain unified risk registers that integrate AI risks with broader organizational risks?

GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.step: Step 8: Advanced Technical and Organizational Measures
GDPR and MSFT DPR Onboarding Questionair.question: Do you conduct joint audits or assessments that cover multiple compliance domains simultaneously?

ISO 27701 Onboarding Questionaire.question: What is the name of your organization and primary business activity?
Do you act as a data controller, data processor, or both?
Do you have a designated Data Protection Officer (DPO)?
Have you defined privacy roles and responsibilities across your teams?
Is personal data governance integrated with your ISMS governance?
Do you maintain a data inventory or Record of Processing Activities (RoPA)?
Do you classify personal data types collected (e.g., contact, financial, biometric)?
Do you maintain a lawful basis for processing personal data (e.g., consent, contract)?
Do you track sensitive or special category data separately?
Do you store any personal data outside the EU/EEA?
Do you have a published privacy notice?
Do you request user consent where required (e.g., cookies, marketing)?
Do you log and manage user consent records?
Do you allow users to withdraw or manage their consent preferences?
Do you have a defined process for handling data subject access requests (DSARs)?
Do you track response time and fulfillment of DSARs?
Can data subjects request correction or deletion of their data?
Do you support data portability and objection to processing?
Do you maintain a list of third parties who receive personal data?
Do you assess processor privacy compliance before onboarding them?
Do you have signed DPAs or privacy clauses in contracts with processors?
Do you review and re-assess processors on a periodic basis?
Do you conduct privacy risk assessments or PIA/DPIAs for new projects?
Do you log identified privacy risks and assign treatment actions?
Do you perform regular privacy reviews as part of change management?
Have you trained key staff on privacy risk and impact assessment?
Do you apply encryption or pseudonymization to personal data?
Do you have a defined data retention schedule?
Do you securely delete or anonymize personal data post-retention?
Do you restrict personal data access on a need-to-know basis?
Do you provide privacy training to staff?
Do you communicate privacy obligations during onboarding?
Do you run awareness campaigns (e.g., Privacy Day, phishing simulations)?
Do you track policy acknowledgment specific to privacy policies?
Do you maintain a privacy risk register?
Do you define and track KPIs for privacy performance?
Do you review privacy program status with management or the board?
Have you had any privacy audits or regulatory interactions?
Do you conduct transfer impact assessments (TIAs) for international data flows?
Do you maintain binding corporate rules (BCRs) or rely on adequacy decisions?
Do you monitor changes in data protection laws in countries where you transfer data?
Do you have contractual safeguards beyond standard contractual clauses (SCCs)?

ISO 27701 Onboarding Questionaire.step: Step 12: Privacy Engineering and Technical Controls
ISO 27701 Onboarding Questionaire.question: Do you implement technical privacy controls (anonymization, pseudonymization, differential privacy)?

ISO 27701 Onboarding Questionaire.step: Step 12: Privacy Engineering and Technical Controls
ISO 27701 Onboarding Questionaire.question: Do you conduct privacy impact assessments for new technologies or processing activities?

ISO 27701 Onboarding Questionaire.step: Step 12: Privacy Engineering and Technical Controls
ISO 27701 Onboarding Questionaire.question: Do you apply data minimization principles in system design and data collection?
Do you use automated decision-making or profiling that requires disclosure under Article 22?
Do you provide meaningful information about the logic involved in automated decisions?
Do you allow individuals to request human intervention in automated decisions?

ISO 27017 and 27018 Cloud Security and P.question: Do you operate as a cloud service provider (CSP), cloud customer, or both?
Do you handle or process personally identifiable information (PII) in your cloud environment?
Do you use shared responsibility documentation to delineate CSP vs customer obligations?
Do you rely on sub-processors or infrastructure providers (e.g., AWS, Azure, GCP)?
Do you enforce separation of customer environments (logical or physical)?
Are administrative operations (e.g., patching, config changes) logged and reviewed?
Do you implement baseline security controls per ISO/IEC 27001 Annex A?
Are cryptographic controls (e.g., TLS, key mgmt) applied to protect customer data?
Is there a documented and tested procedure for data deletion, return, and portability?
Do you provide notice to customers regarding personal data processing?
Do you allow customers to access, correct, or delete their data?
Do you record disclosures of PII to third parties?
Do you have controls in place to restrict access to PII to authorized personnel only?
Do you notify customers promptly in the event of a PII breach?
Do you conduct periodic audits for cloud PII protection practices?
Have you integrated privacy-by-design into your cloud service architecture?
Do you document and track compliance obligations related to PII and cloud data?
Do you maintain a customer data retention and deletion policy?
Do you train staff on cloud-specific security and privacy responsibilities?
Do you perform risk assessments specific to cloud and privacy threats?
Do you isolate and investigate incidents across multi-tenant environments?
Do you conduct cloud-specific forensics and evidence preservation?
Do you provide incident notification and communication to affected cloud customers?
Do you support standardized data export formats and secure APIs for data portability?
Do you provide migration assistance and data transition services to customers?
Do you ensure interoperability with other cloud services and platforms?
Do you address data sovereignty requirements and location restrictions?
Do you have procedures for responding to government access requests and legal process?
Do you provide customers with visibility into data location and movement?
Do you assess and communicate jurisdictional risks to customers?
